original: @196b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @196b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: su kla badzra yo gi n'i s'a dha nam /
analyzed: su kla badzra yo gi n'i s'a dha nam /
translated: Sukla-vajrayoginisādhana

original: bod skad du /🔽rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs //
analyzed: bod skad du / rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs //
translated: In Tibetan:🔽Dkar mo rdo rje rnal ’byor ma’i sgrub thabs

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajrayoginī.

original: dang po re zhig ae wam gi dbus su pam yig las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la /
analyzed: dang po re zhig ae wam gi dbus su pam yig las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la /
translated: First, in the middle of e vaṃ, from a paṃ syllable arises a multicolored lotus with a stamen.

original: aam yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: aam yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: In its center, from a white aṃ syllable, is a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du h'um @197a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um @197a * //
translated: Upon that, a white hūṃ

original: dkar po yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dkar mo //
analyzed: dkar po yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dkar mo //
translated: completely transforms into Bhagavatī Vajrayoginī, white in color.

original: gcer bu rgyan med pa skra grol ba /
analyzed: gcer bu rgyan med pa skra grol ba /
translated: She is naked, without ornaments, and her hair is loose.

original: zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: zhal gcig ma /
translated: She has one face.

original: phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: phyag gnyis ma /
translated: She has two arms.

original: phyag g-yon pa kha tv'am ga dang thod pa thogs pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa kha tv'am ga dang thod pa thogs pa /
translated: Her left hand holds a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup.

original: g-yas pas rdo rje tho ba thogs pa /
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje tho ba thogs pa /
translated: Her right hand holds a vajra hammer.

original: zhabs gcig bteg pas brgya byin dang changs pa mnan pa /
analyzed: zhabs gcig bteg pas brgya byin dang changs pa mnan pa /
translated: She raises one foot, stepping on Indra and Brahmā.

original: zhabs gcig gi 'og tu 'jigs byed chen po dang dus mtshan mnan pa /
analyzed: zhabs gcig gi 'og tu 'jigs byed chen po dang dus mtshan mnan pa /
translated: Under the other foot, she steps on Mahābhairava and Kālarātri.

original: zhal las rtag tu bdud rtsi 'phyang ba /
analyzed: zhal las rtag tu bdud rtsi 'phyang ba /
translated: Nectar always hangs from her mouth.

original: spyan gsum pa spyan rtsa dmar zhing zlum pa /🔽'gyur ba gtum pa'i spyan //🔽dpral ba'i mdzod spur khro gnyer dang ldan pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa spyan rtsa dmar zhing zlum pa / 'gyur ba gtum pa'i spyan // dpral ba'i mdzod spur khro gnyer dang ldan pa /
translated: She has three eyes, her eye-veins are red and round.🔽Her eyes are wrathful and fierce.🔽Her forehead has a frown.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: She bares her fangs.

original: shin tu gtum pa'i gzugs can /🔽dur khrod la sogs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu gtum pa'i gzugs can / dur khrod la sogs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: She has a very fierce form.

original: skyon bzlas pa bya ste //
analyzed: skyon bzlas pa bya ste //
translated: One should meditate on her in a charnel ground, and so forth.🔽One should do the recitation of the mantra.

original: bzlas pa'i sngags ni //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i sngags ni //
translated: The mantra for the recitation is:

original: aom sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye /
analyzed: aom sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye /
translated: Om sarva buddha dakiniye

original: badzra warna n'i ye /
analyzed: badzra warna n'i ye /
translated: vajra varnaniye

original: badzra bee ro tsa n'i h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat /
analyzed: badzra bee ro tsa n'i h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat /
translated: vajra vairocanini hum hum hum phat phat phat

original: sv'a h'a / rtsa ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: sv'a h'a / rtsa ba'i sngags ni /
translated: svaha. The root mantra is:

original: aom badzra d'a ki n'i hr'i: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki n'i hr'i: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Om vajra dakini hri: hum phat svaha.

original: nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: This is the near essence.

original: aom badzra yo gi n'i h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra yo gi n'i h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Om vajra yogini hri: hum phat svaha.

original: aom bam h'um /
analyzed: aom bam h'um /
translated: Om bam hum.

original: snying po'i sngags so //
analyzed: snying po'i sngags so //
translated: This is the essence mantra.

original: de bzhin du gtor ma'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtor ma'i sngags ni /
translated: Likewise, the mantra for the bali offering is:

original: aom badzra yo gi n'i ai mam ba lim grihna grihna ru ru kha kha kha kha phem phem phem phem aa aa aa aa ma ma siddhi pra yatstsha h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra yo gi n'i ai mam ba lim grihna grihna ru ru kha kha kha kha phem phem phem phem aa aa aa aa ma ma siddhi pra yatstsha h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajrayoginī, accept my bali, gṛhṇa gṛhṇa, ru ru, kha kha kha kha, pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ, a ā ā ā, ma ma siddhi pra yaccha hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la nges par mchod pa dang / bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la nges par mchod pa dang / bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should definitely make offerings and meditate on the eighth and fourteenth days of the lunar month.

original: rgyal po aindra bhu ti'i gzhung rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyal po aindra bhu ti'i gzhung rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of white Vajrayoginī according to the system of King Indrabhūti is complete.

original: // / bla ma bee ro tsa nas bsgyur//
analyzed: // / bla ma bee ro tsa nas bsgyur//
translated: Translated by Guru Vairotsana.
